content: looshkin pattern written by sarah weigel what you need blue yarn and crochet hook to match weight of yarn i used dk yarn and a 3 5mm hook small amount of black yarn to embroider eyes and nose needle and scissors for embroidering eyes weaving in ends toy stuffing or cotton wool/filling stitches used us terminology chain chain stitch slip_stitch slipstitch single_crochet single_crochet loops 3 loops on hook yarn over again insert hook in same stitch pull up 1 loops yarn over and pull through 2 loops yarn over and pull through all 4 loops pattern start with the head working in continuous rounds i have given a stitch count for each round at the end i added a stitch marker for the centre of the front of the body the tail will be in the middle on the reverse side feet should be same side as the stitch marker with the 2sc separating them directly below the marker you may need to adjust your count a little to place the features in the right place head r1 6sc round 6st r2
